Detailed Description

This class provides access to terrain height map data for the second generation of terrain.

bool TerrainHeightMap1::hmCollide ( WorldTriangle const &  source,
Vector3 const &  extent,
float  xStart,
float  zStart,
float  xEnd,
float  zEnd,
TerrainCollisionCallback *  pCallback 
) const

This function collides a prism with a rect in the heightmap.

Parameters:
source the start triangle of the prism
extent the end location of the prism
xStart the x start location of our rect
zStart the z start location of our rect
xEnd the x end location of our rect
zEnd the z end location of our rect
pCallback the collision callback
Returns:
true if collision should stop

bool TerrainHeightMap1::hmCollide ( Vector3 const &  originalSource,
Vector3 const &  source,
Vector3 const &  extent,
TerrainCollisionCallback *  pCallback 
) const

This function does line-segment intersection tests with the terrain using the height map values.

Parameters:
originalSource The source of the unclipped line-segment.
source The source of the line-segment.
extent The end of the line-segment.
pCallback The terrain collision callback.
Returns:
true if collision should stop

TerrainHeightMap1::ImageType const & TerrainHeightMap1::image (  )  const [virtual]

This function accesses the TerrainMap as though it is an image.

This function can be called outside a lock/unlock pair.

Returns:
The TerrainMap as an image.

Implements Terrain::TerrainMap< float >.

bool TerrainHeightMap1::load ( DataSectionPtr  dataSection,
std::string *  error = NULL 
) [virtual]

This function loads the TerrainMap from a DataSection that was saved via TerrainMap::save.

You should not call this between lock/unlock pairs.

Parameters:
dataSection The /terrain DataSection in the cdata file.
error If not NULL and an error occurs then this will be set to a reason why the error occurred.
Returns:
true if the load was successful.

Implements Terrain::TerrainMap< float >.
